articles.author: Maya Gebeily, Alexander Cornwell
articles.description: Israeli strikes killed 22 people and injured more than 100 in central Beirut on Thursday, Lebanese authorities said, as a senior Hezbollah official evaded an Israeli assassination attempt in the city, according to three security sources.
articles.title: Israeli strikes kill 22 in Beirut as Hezoballah leader evades assassination

articles.author: Jack Kim
articles.description: North Korea marked a founding anniversary of its ruling Workers' Party with a celebratory concert and banquet, and leader Kim Jong Un called for renewed training of all workers into revolutionaries espousing communism, state media said on Friday.
articles.title: North Korea's Kim lauds 'longest ruling party' on anniversary with Russian guests

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: At least 20 miners were killed and seven injured in an attack by armed men on a small private coal mine in the southwestern Pakistani province of Balochistan on Friday, police said.
articles.title: At least 20 killed in attack on miners in southwestern Pakistan, police say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Mexican senators on Thursday passed regulations stipulating how a judicial overhaul reforming the constitution will be implemented.
articles.title: Mexican Senate approves regulations on judicial reform, legislation heads to lower house

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Chinese Premier Li Qiang said he hopes Japan can meet China halfway and keep bilateral relations on the right track, state media reported.
articles.title: China hopes Japan can meet it halfway, keep relations on right track, says Chinese premier

articles.author: Steven Aristil
articles.description: Armed men launched fresh attacks on the Haitian town of Arcahaie, local media reported on Wednesday, as families mourned the growing list of victims of a massacre days earlier in an agricultural town some 60 km (37 miles) to the north.
articles.title: Haitian gangs press fresh attacks as families mourn massacre

articles.author: Jason Lange, Bo Erickson
articles.description: Harris leads Trump among voters in the vast middle of American society by 47% to 41%.
articles.title: Exclusive: Harris overtakes Trump among suburban voters, Reuters/Ipsos polling shows

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Britain's King Charles and Queen Camilla will host Qatar's Emir Sheikh Tamim bin Hamad Al Thani at Buckingham Palace for a state visit from Dec. 3-4, the palace said on Friday.
articles.title: Britain King Charles to host Qatar's Emir for December state visit

articles.author: Lewis Jackson
articles.description: Pacific Island nations are at risk of becoming bases for global criminal gangs, a report by the United Nations drug authority said on Friday, as criminal activity surges across the isolated and economically vulnerable region.
articles.title: Pacific Island nations at risk of becoming footholds for global crime gangs, says UN

articles.author: Horacio Soria
articles.description: Argentina's triple-digit inflation, among the world's highest, is starting to slow but this offers little relief for residents whose salaries have stayed the same while costs of basic goods sky-rocketed and the government slashed state subsidies.
articles.title: Argentina's triple-digit inflation slows, but cash-strapped workers struggle to pay bills
